message: Aha!
i'll wait and check again in a half hour
@djchall We have that functionality on the invite page, it might just not be clear, it's the "Know someone on Convore already?" part.
@ericflo okay, that's embarrassing... i completely ignored that other section of the page
I'd like to be able to invite people by Convore username, not just email address.
@djchall We even do some nice autocomplete stuff too
hrmmm
@djchall No that just means we really need to make it more clear, you're not the first person to do that.
@ericflo @leah: what is supposed to actually happen when you invite a convore user to a group? generate an email? in-app message? so far it doesn't seem to have done anything
@djchall So it sends an e-mail and it's supposed to show them something on the top of their screen, but there's a bug in the stuff on the top of the screen right now so it's just sending the e-mail
hm, i'll check in gmail
okay i had some convore messages in my junk folder
but not the email for the invitation I just issued
Hmm, I just sent an invite and it worked
I just sent an invite to an email address and I received it instantly
@ericflo you sent an invite to a current member?
A-ha, I figured it out... I was entering "@fozboot" in the field, instead of just fozboot
I guess an email address was being generated
er, I mean an error message was being generated

I also issued a bunch of invitations to Convore users to my Drinking group, and none of them have been accepted, which suggests either people don't like drinking, or the sending of emails for group invitations really is broken
@djchall yeah, just worked
Good feedback though, we should strip out @-signs
but it was at the top of the screen, and I just ignored it (probably because I thought it was just a confirmation)
but i agree, there's no reason not to strip out @ signs since that's such an easy mistake to make
what i saw is that if you try to invite someone with a username and include the @
when the page reloads, you don't see the error about @ being an invalid username character
but i haven't really thought about how i would do it
but no invitation is issued, of course
interesting
I think I know what the issue is now
the form is being collapsed so you don't see the error
Oh, so you're saying the error message is hidden in that panel of the accordion that's collapsed?
I'll file a ticket for that
aha
I have to think about how to do it, but yeah, please assign to me.
Probably gonna just be js
I kind of think that the accordion could show more than one section at a time
a little :)
@ericflo can you fix that quickly?
is that crazy?
@leah: i tested this again tonight, and it looks like the fix that was implemented doesn't quite work right with the redesigned invite page
unless you click the invite user section of that page
and since there's no other error, it appears to the user like it worked
i like the enhanced functionality of that page, but not totally sure about the presentation
